main event: An unidentified flying object was sighted by military pilots over the Pacific Ocean on April 2, 1966.
interesting points: The object was initially a ball, then broke up into two jagged pieces of equal size.
The ball was dime-sized, and the two pieces were the size of peas.
The object had a brilliant white center with red and blue fringing at the trailing edge.
The object's trail had a teardrop shape for the ball and then for the two pieces.
The object appeared to the pilots as a possible exploding aircraft or destructed missile.
result: The object was determined to be a probable meteor.
sighted object: An unidentified flying object that initially appeared as a ball and then broke up into two pieces.
witnesses: 6 military personnel, including the pilot, co-pilot, observer, flight engineer, and radio operator.
photographs: No photographs were present in the report.
